bug.short_desc: home and end not working anymore with tcsh
bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: Since screen 4.4.0 the home and end keys no longer work in screen when using tcsh as shell.
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): 4.4.0
How reproducible: always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. start screen: $ screen
2. start tcsh $ tcsh
3. make sure home and end are bound: $ bindkey | egrep '^(home|end)' home -> beginning-of-line end -> end-of-line
4. press home or end
Actual results: nothing happens pressing "home" while "end" prints a "~".
Expected results: cursor jumps to the beginning or end of the line.
Additional info: home and end work fine with 3.4.1-4.fc24. No problems with other arrow keys like left/up/right/down or when using bash.
This issue has caused in one of last update of screen. In version 4.4.0-1 all works fine. I will look at this as soon as possible.
screen-4.4.0-4.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-3e989e7ad7
screen-4.4.0-4.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-0a4db22b9d
screen-4.4.0-4.fc23 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 23. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-0bf724f8ea

screen-4.4.0-4.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-0a4db22b9d
